name: Number of king permutations on n elements not beginning with the smallest element.
comment: A permutation p(1)p(2)...p(n) is a king permutation if |p(i+1)-p(i)|>1 for each 0<i<n. a(n) counts king permutations of length n that do not begin with the smallest element.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..450
Dan Li and Philip B. Zhang, Distributions of mesh patterns of short lengths on king permutations, arXiv:2411.18131 [math.CO], 2024. See formula (2) at page 5.
example: For n = 4 the a(4) = 2 solutions are the two permutations 2413 and 3142.
mathematica: nmax = 20; CoefficientList[Series[Sum[k!*x^k*(1-x)^k/(1+x)^(k+1), {k, 0, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Apr 04 2025 *)
author: _Dan Li_, Apr 01 2025

name: Number of king permutations on n elements not beginning with the smallest element and not ending with the largest element.
comment: A permutation p(1)p(2)...p(n) is a king permutation if |p(i+1)-p(i)|>1 for each 0<i<n. a(n) counts king permutations of length n that do not begin with the smallest element and do not end with the largest element.
link: Dan Li and Philip B. Zhang, Distributions of mesh patterns of short lengths on king permutations, arXiv:2411.18131 [math.CO], 2024. See formula (3) at page 5.
example: For n = 4 the a(4) = 2 solutions are the two permutations 2413 and 3142.
mathematica: nmax = 20; CoefficientList[Series[x/(1+x) + Sum[k!*x^k*(1-x)^k/(1+x)^(k+2), {k, 0, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Apr 04 2025 *)
author: _Dan Li_, Apr 01 2025

name: Number of king permutations on n elements without strict fixed points.
comment: A permutation p(1)p(2)...p(n) is a king permutation if |p(i+1)-p(i)|>1 for each 0<i<n. a(n) counts king permutations of length n that have no strict fixed points (that is, that avoid the mesh pattern of length 1 with squares (0,1) and (1,0) shaded).
link: Dan Li and Philip B. Zhang, Distributions of mesh patterns of short lengths on king permutations, arXiv:2411.18131 [math.CO], 2024. See formula (7) at page 6.
formula: G.f.: (1 + t)*A(t)/(1 + t + t*A(t)) where A(t)=Sum_{n >= 0} n!*t^n*(1-t)^n/(1+t)^n is the g.f. for king permutations given by A002464.
example: a(4) = 2 corresponds to these two permutations: 2413, 3142.
mathematica: nmax = 20; CoefficientList[Series[(1+x)/(x + (1+x)/Sum[k!*x^k*(1-x)^k/(1+x)^k, {k, 0, nmax}]), {x, 0, nmax}], x] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Apr 04 2025 *)
author: _Dan Li_, Apr 02 2025
